title: Executive Order 8752-Amendment of Executive Order No. 8712 of March 15, 1941, Prescribing Regulations Governing the Exportation of Articles and Materials Designated in Proclamations Issued Pursuant to the Provisions of Section 6 of the Act of Congress Approved July 2, 1940
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 6 of the act of Congress approved July 2, 1940, entitled "An Act to expedite the strengthening of the national defense" (54 Stat. 712, 714), I hereby amend Executive Order No. 8712 of March 15, 1941, prescribing regulations governing the exportation of articles and materials designated in proclamations issued pursuant to the provisions of section 6 of the act of Congress approved July 2, 1940, by striking out and revoking paragraph numbered 11 thereof.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8752-Amendment of Executive Order No. 8712 of March 15, 1941, Prescribing Regulations Governing the Exportation of Articles and Materials Designated in Proclamations Issued Pursuant to the Provisions of Section 6 of the Act of Congress Approved July 2, 1940 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372094
